The Work at Madison. 

                                Sanitarium, Cal., Oct. 10, 1906. 

To the Brethren and Sisters in Nashville and in Madison:-- 
     Among brethren engaged in various lines of the Lord's work there should  ever be seen a desire to encourage and strengthen one another. The Lord is not pleased with the course of those who make the way difficult for some who are doing a work appointed to them by the Master. If these critics were placed in the position of those whom they criticize, they would desire far different treatment from their brethren.
